screen:
-= Info about function 'SHELL' =-
[Syntax] SHELL(<command>)
[Synopsis] Executes a command as if you were at a shell.
[Description] Returns the value from a system command Example: Set(foo=${SHELL(echo "bar")}) Note: When using the SHELL() dialplan function, your "SHELL" is /bin/sh, which may differ as to the underlying shell, depending upon your production platform. Also keep in mind that if you are using a common path, you should be mindful of race conditions that could result from two calls running SHELL() simultaneously.
